messages.title: CORBYN'S BREXIT DELAY = THREAT TO JOBS
messages.content: Boris Johnson has secured a Brexit deal with the EU. And as the Bank of England Chief says, the deal is positive for the UK economy. That's because the deal protects jobs and trade. Protects workers' rights and environmental standards. And ends the uncertainty facing our economy.

messages.title: LET'S UNLEASH BRITAIN'S POTENTIAL
messages.content: Let's get Brexit done. Let's unleash Britain's potential. Don't risk more delay with five years of Corbyn.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: More funding for every pupil in every school
£3.6 billion to help towns invest and attract new businesses
30 million more trees for cleaner air
Gigabit broadband for the whole country

issues.brexitEurope: Boris Johnson has secured a Brexit deal with the EU.
issues.economy: A Brexit deal... is positive for the UK economy. That's good for jobs.
issues.education: More funding for every pupil in every school.
issues.environment: 30 million more trees for cleaner air.

endorsements.endorsement: We simply cannot afford another 'wasted year of political paralysis'.

endorsements.endorser: A Confederation of British Industry chief
endorsements.endorsement: warns that more indecision will promote ill will and lead to less investment.

endorsements.endorser: Mark Carney; Bank of England chief
endorsements.endorsement: Boris Johnson's Brexit deal is good for the UK's economy and means good for jobs.

quotes.text: Brexit uncertainty drives up job losses and holds back economy.
A more delay and uncertainty on Brexit just means more damage to the economy.
Mark Carney: Brexit deal 'positive' for UK economy.
Boris Johnson's Brexit deal is good for the UK. That means good for jobs.

images.caption: Boris Johnson working with construction workers.
New hospitals and police forces being planned.
Families and professionals aspiring for a better country.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet focuses on the potential negative impacts of a Brexit delay and promotes the Conservative party's policies and achievements under Boris Johnson's leadership. It presents a narrative of moving forward with Brexit to allow investment in public services and infrastructure.
